attributes.action: Officially recognise the Armed Forces who provide Aid to the Civil Authorities.
attributes.additional_details:
The General Service Medal with a new Clasp "United Kingdom" would recognise the hardship, commitment and readiness to act in support to the community that our Armed Forces display through these short-notice tasks. 

Examples include: Cover for Prison Service Strikes, Flood Relief during Christmas Leave, Replacement Fuel Tanker Drivers, Replacement Fire Service Personnel, Bus Drivers for Public Transport (Train Strikes) and Security to Key Infrastructure in UK Emergencies.
attributes.background: The Armed Forces are increasingly being used to in support of the Civil Authorities for Public Sector Strikes & Emergencies. To allow Armed Forces Personnel to proudly show their service to the community, they should be entitled to the General Service Medal 2008 for official MACA Operations.
